message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.DC 

This paper discusses the use of wireless sensor networks (WSNs) in the context of the Internet of Things (IoT), which is a topic that falls under the category of computer networks (cs.NI). The paper specifically focuses on the use of the 6LoWPAN protocol stack, which is a standard for IPv6 communication over low-power wireless networks, and proposes an architecture for enabling efficient and controlled multi-hop forwarding over 6LoWPANs using Software Defined Networking (SDN). This involves network reconfigurability, which is a topic that falls under the categories of information theory (cs.IT) and control systems (cs.SY). The paper also discusses communication challenges in industrial systems, which could be considered a topic in the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR). Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the proposed architecture in a simulated environment, which could be considered a topic in the category of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC).
